premises_used.natural: If drug X is manufactured by Company Beta, then drug X is quality-checked by Inspector Gamma.
Drug X being quality-checked by Inspector Gamma implies that drug X is approved by the FDA.

steps.natural: Whenever drug X is manufactured by Company Beta, drug X is approved by the FDA.

steps.natural: Provided drug X is not safe for patients, drug X is approved by the FDA.

premises_used.prover9_expression: (-(-(manufactured(drug_x, company_beta) -> approved(drug_x, fda)) -> recalled(drug_x, market)) -> investigated(drug_x, authorities))
premises_used.natural: Assuming it is not the case that the failure of drug X being manufactured by Company Beta to imply FDA approval results in a market recall, then drug X is investigated by the authorities.

premises_used.prover9_expression: (-(-(manufactured(drug_x, company_beta) -> approved(drug_x, fda)) -> recalled(drug_x, market)) -> -investigated(drug_x, authorities))
premises_used.natural: Given that it is not true that the absence of the implication from drug X being manufactured by Company Beta to FDA approval causes a market recall, then drug X is not investigated by the authorities.

steps.natural: If it is not the case that drug X being manufactured by Company Beta implies drug X is approved by the FDA, then drug X is recalled from the market.
